name: State_13

timeline_beats.label: Founding as a coastal league of ports
Expansion of shipyards and saltworks; formalized fisheries controls
Joined Coastal Defense Compact; naval modernization
Market integration with river trade; reagent transshipment hub

factions.label: Grand Merchant Guild
factions.influence_hint: Controls overseas trade rights, port tariffs, reagent imports

factions.label: Fisher Co-operatives
factions.influence_hint: Mass social base; enforces seasonal moratoria

factions.label: Naval Admiralty
factions.influence_hint: Sea defense, convoy protection, alliance representation

factions.label: Ritual Dockwrights
factions.influence_hint: Shipwrights who embed short-range auguries; control scarce reagents

factions.label: Harbor Barons
factions.influence_hint: Localized control of quays and smuggling networks

traits: maritime oral epics and port cant
practical literacy for navigation and account-keeping
clan-linked cooperative labor for nets and boats

constraints: Tech baseline: near-medieval to early industrial; no high-pressure steam megatechs
Ritual magic requires scarce imported reagents or specialist labor; consumes reagents
No instant resurrection or true life-replacement magics
Long-range mind-influence rare and institutionally banned
Navigational auguries exist but cannot replace charts and seamanship
Combustion-derived industry limited by fuel and engineering constraints
Must honor inter-state treaties and alliance obligations listed in external_relations_refs
notes: Economy highly sensitive to reagent import lines; reagent-quay security is strategic priority
Seasonal fish moratoria are politically enforced by Fisher Co-operatives and treaty T3
Ports vulnerable to storm surges; coastal defenses prioritized by Naval Admiralty
Internal tension between Guild centralization and Harbor Barons' local control
